properties.Label: Airport Master Plan
properties.ProjectDescription: The current Master Plan was begun in 2006 and is considered outdated due to the projected completion or programmed start of most current projects.
properties.DepartmentPriority: Project has State and federal funding, Project supports essential services
properties.Creator: JONESE

properties.Label: Airport Runway Taxiway
properties.ProjectDescription: The growth in the number of General Aviation aircraft operations, especially by Liberty University flight training students, has resulted in increased need for the use of runway 35-17 which does not have a parallel taxiway.
properties.DepartmentPriority: Project has State and federal funding, Project required to support important but not essential services
properties.Creator: JONESE

properties.Label: Airport Mid-Field Aviation Development Area
properties.ProjectDescription: Area has been identified in the current Airport Master Plan as a prime area for development for General Aviation (GA) use. Development would include construction of ramp and apron areas.
properties.DepartmentPriority: Project has State and federal funding, Project contributes to generation of new revenue
properties.Creator: JONESE

properties.Label: Terminal Refurbishment
properties.ProjectDescription: Improvements to 1) baggage make-up conveyor feed belts & equipment, 2) Terminal Sustainability Improvements (energy saving lighting), and 3) airline and rental car counter upgrades
properties.DepartmentPriority: Project has State and federal funding, Project required to support important but not essential services
properties.Creator: JONESE

properties.Label: Airport Runway Rehab
properties.ProjectDescription: Runway 4-22 underwent its last major rehabilitation in FY2000 and is approaching its estimated 20 year useful life. Rehabilitation would involve grading corrections as well as a complete repaving of the 7, 100 foot runway.
properties.DepartmentPriority: Project has State and federal funding, Project supports essential services
properties.Creator: JONESE

properties.Label: Taxiway B Rehab
properties.ProjectDescription: The Airport's primary taxiway underwent its last major rehabilitation in FY2004 and is approaching its estimated 15 year useful life. Rehabilitation would involve grading corrections as well as a complete overlay.
properties.DepartmentPriority: Project has State and federal funding, Project required to support important but not essential services
properties.Creator: JONESE

properties.Label: Runway 4-22 Parallel Taxiway
properties.ProjectDescription: Anticipated need for a new "east-side" parallel taxiway to the airport main runway due to changes to airport design and safety standards.
properties.DepartmentPriority: Project has a legal or regulatory mandate, Project has State and federal funding
properties.Creator: JONESE
